intro: Aralia turbacensis, commonly known as the mountain aralia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters and features compound leaves with a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
